description: {"blocks":[{"key":"2fakq","text":"This protocol aims to assist those new to qPCR data analysis and those who seek to escape the closed-source, proprietary software tied to their qPCR instrumentation. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f2ssf","text":"Here we describe how to assess the quality of qPCR data and qPCR assays using: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3vumr","text":"- CFX Maestro 2.3, the software native to Bio-Rad qPCR instruments, ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dbo60","text":"- Microsoft Excel version 2404, ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7dj3p","text":"- a Bayesian inference Using Gibbs Sampling (BUGS) script presented by PJ Schmidt et al., ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"abld2","text":"- the 'LOD calculator' R-script, and ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"25bv","text":"- the ‘qpcR’ R software package","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
